alert.note: Alert for De Soto; Sabine (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 25 at 2:55AM CDT by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern De Soto, southeastern Red River, northwestern Natchitoches and Sabine Parishes through 330 AM CDT... At 254 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 6 miles southwest of Coushatta to near Zwolle to near Toledo Bend Dam. Movement was east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Many, Coushatta, Allen, Pleasant Hill, Florien, Fisher, Robeline, Powhatan, Lake End, Evelyn, Mount Carmel, Belmont, Hanna, Negreet, Columbus, Marthaville, Rambin, Hagewood and Ajax. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 300 AM CDT for eastern Texas.
